by a new owner to accept an ownership transfer\r"},"acceptTokenOwnership()":{"details":"used by a new owner to accept a token ownership transfer\r can only be called by the contract owner\r note that token ownership can only be accepted if its total-supply is greater than zero\r"},"addConnector(address,uint32,bool)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"addReserve(address,address,uint32)":{"details":"all compound tokens going to be listed should be passed through this function with their underlying token. ","params":{"_cToken":"compound token contract address of the underlying token","_ratio":"constant reserve ratio, represented in ppm, 1-1000000     ","_uToken":"undelying token used by compound cToken"}},"addReserve(address,uint32)":{"details":"defines a new reserve for the token\r can only be called by the owner while the converter is inactive\r note that prior to version 17, you should use 'addConnector' instead\r \r","params":{"_ratio":"constant reserve ratio, represented in ppm, 1-1000000\r","_token":"address of the reserve token\r"}},"addReserveBalance(address,uint256)":{"details":"This function aims to automate the minting of coumpound tokens when adding its underlying tokens to the reserve It allow also the deposit of any reserve token, user should first approve the ERC20 transer. ","params":{"_amount":"token amount to be deposited     ","_reserveToken":"token address"}},"approveTokensToCompound()":{"details":"This function approves the underlying token used as reserve to be spent by the compound tokens contracts it is most likely to not be called, since apporval of the underlying token is set max_uint for the compound token it is just a safety measure.     "},"cAmount2uAmount(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"returns the converted value of a compound token to its underlying token value ","params":{"_cAmount":"compound token amount to convert ","_cToken":"compound token contract address of the underlying token ","_uToken":"underlying token address used as asset in compound token contract"},"return":"converted compound token amount"},"change(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"claimTokens(address,uint256)":{"details":"allows the associated BancorX contract to claim tokens from any address (so that users\r dont have to first give allowance when calling BancorX)\r \r","params":{"_amount":"the amount of tokens to claim\r","_from":"address to claim the tokens from\r"}},"completeXConversion(address[],uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"completeXConversion2(address[],uint256,uint256)":{"details":"allows a user to convert BNT that was sent from another blockchain into any other\r token on the BancorNetwork without specifying the amount of BNT to be converted, but\r rather by providing the xTransferId which allows us to get the amount from BancorX.\r note that prior to version 16, you should use 'completeXConversion' instead\r \r","params":{"_conversionId":"pre-determined unique (if non zero) id which refers to this transaction \r \r","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero\r","_path":"conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract\r"},"return":"tokens issued in return\r"},"connectorTokenCount()":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"connectorTokens(uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"connectors(address)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"convert(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"convert2(address,address,uint256,uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"converts a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken note that prior to version 16, you should use 'convert' instead ","params":{"_affiliateAccount":"affiliate account","_affiliateFee":"affiliate fee in PPM ","_amount":"amount to convert, in fromToken","_fromToken":"ERC20 token to convert from","_minReturn":"if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero","_toToken":"ERC20 token to convert to"},"return":"conversion return amount"},"getConnectorBalance(address)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"getCrossConnectorReturn(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"getFinalAmount(uint256,uint8)":{"details":"given a return amount, returns the amount minus the conversion fee\r \r","params":{"_amount":"return amount\r","_magnitude":"1 for standard conversion, 2 for cross reserve conversion\r \r"},"return":"return amount minus conversion fee\r"},"getReserveBalance(address)":{"details":"returns the reserve's balance following the token address, if the token is an underlying token is hold by compound ctoken contract. note that prior to version 17, you should use 'getConnectorBalance' instead ","params":{"_reserveToken":"reserve token contract address "},"return":"reserve balance"},"getReserveRatio(address)":{"details":"returns the reserve's ratio\r added in version 22\r \r","params":{"_reserveToken":"reserve token contract address\r \r"},"return":"reserve ratio\r"},"getReturn(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"calculates the expected return of converting a given amount of tokens ","params":{"_amount":"amount of tokens received from the user ","_fromToken":"contract address of the token to convert from","_toToken":"contract address of the token to convert to"},"return":"amount of tokens that the user will receiveamount of tokens that the user will pay as fee"},"quickConvert(address[],uint256,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"quickConvertPrioritized(address[],uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"deprecated, backward reserve tokens defined\r note that prior to version 17, you should use 'connectorTokenCount' instead\r \r","return":"number of reserve tokens\r"},"restoreRegistry()":{"details":"restores the previous contract-registry\r"},"restrictRegistryUpdate(bool)":{"details":"restricts the permission to update the contract-registry\r \r","params":{"_onlyOwnerCanUpdateRegistry":"indicates whether or not permission is restricted to owner only\r"}},"setBancorX(address)":{"details":"allows the owner to set the associated BancorX contract\r","params":{"_bancorX":"BancorX contract\r"}},"setConversionFee(uint32)":{"details":"updates the current conversion fee\r can only be called by the contract owner\r \r","params":{"_conversionFee":"new conversion fee, represented in ppm\r"}},"setConversionWhitelist(address)":{"details":"allows the owner to update & enable the conversion whitelist contract address\r when set, only addresses that are whitelisted are actually allowed to use the converter\r note that the whitelist check is actually done by the BancorNetwork contract\r \r","params":{"_whitelist":"address of a whitelist contract\r"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"allows transferring the contract ownership\r the new owner still needs to accept the transfer\r can only be called by the contract owner\r \r","params":{"_newOwner":"new contract owner\r"}},"transferTokenOwnership(address)":{"details":"allows transferring the token ownership\r the new owner needs to accept the transfer\r can only be called by the contract owner\r note that token ownership can only be transferred while the owner is the converter upgrader contract\r \r","params":{"_newOwner":"new token owner\r"}},"uAmount2cAmount(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"returns the converted value of an underlying amount in compound to compound tokens value ","params":{"_cToken":"compound token contract address of the underlying token","_uAmount":"underlying amount to convert ","_uToken":"underlying token address used as asset in compound token contract"},"return":"converted underlying amount"},"updateConnector(address,uint32,bool,uint256)":{"details":"deprecated, backward compatibility"},"updateRegistry()":{"details":"updates to the new contract-registry\r"},"updateReserveVirtualBalance(address,uint256)":{"details":"updates a reserve's virtual balance\r only used during an upgrade process\r can only be called by the contract owner while the owner is the converter upgrader contract\r note that prior to version 17, you should use 'updateConnector' instead\r \r","params":{"_reserveToken":"address of the reserve token\r","_virtualBalance":"new reserve virtual balance, or 0 to disable virtual balance\r"}},"withdrawFromToken(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"withdraws tokens held by the controller and sends them to an account\r can only be called by the owner\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to withdraw\r","_to":"account to receive the new amount\r","_token":"ERC20 token contract address\r"}},"withdrawTokens(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"withdraws tokens held by the converter and sends them to an account\r can only be called by the owner\r note that reserve tokens can only be withdrawn by the owner while the converter is inactive\r unless the owner is the converter upgrader contract\r \r","params":{"_amount":"amount to withdraw\r","_to":"account to receive the new ol/bancorContracts/solidity/contracts/utility/interfaces/IOwned.sol":{"keccak256":"0x738d19fc1c5a71283c0bc400278e775b21c0cbf62c03852abde81ded30c9ba0f","urls":["bzzr://9064b8a0c73cdb04eb3c84519f8c53382881977c0b2de18532d9fa59148934de"]},"/home/faycal/Desktop/projects/BancorCompoundPool/bancorContracts/solidity/contracts/utility/interfaces/ITokenHolder.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe652e6fb418265340bb9704e5ad9c33173de6ed6efc95114112915a8675ae9a3","urls":["bzzr://d537e87dd6bc47263da27a6a4e97fcebfc31bb5aa2e3a3d5082e3ef787a0e591"]},"/home/faycal/Desktop/projects/BancorCompoundPool/bancorContracts/solidity/contracts/utility/interfaces/IWhitelist.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6623a077a89e9f56c18ade09c9ce490fa05080b3de2a18c8772fa443885a5255","urls":["bzzr://a03ec0f720b11a840ebec69965133ba9223a7a4e035e7cdcbf2e0d1f6293678d"]},"/home/faycal/Desktop/projects/BancorCompoundPool/contracts/BCConverter.sol":{"keccak256":"0x2c3f3e7f51b670a6fe93f4b9f5771998ff57a5abe50171d1660044bae24143f7","urls":["bzzr://bc331a88261acb76d4088ed4dde3191d905c0a3d6ecfcb9742efe50ed4a41795"]},"/home/faycal/Desktop/projects/BancorCompoundPool/contracts/interfaces/ICToken.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8a6ecd1fa7c0a3ff1ce8f26c3e84836d47870358758ca6d729ffee29d7a089fb","urls":["bzzr://ec4d0143389c5387e261aff078b0e3dec004fd1a2d31d9c24c9f0d56b35c3c5b"]}},"version":1}

nodes.name: addReserve
approveTokensToCompound
addReserveBalance
uAmount2cAmount
cAmount2uAmount

nodes.documentation:
@dev returns the reserve's balance following the token address, if the token is an underlying token
is hold by compound ctoken contract.
note that prior to version 17, you should use 'getConnectorBalance' instead

      * @param _reserveToken    reserve token contract address

      * @return reserve balance
nodes.name: getReserveBalance

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) returns (function (contract IERC20Token[] memory,uint256,uint256,address,address,uint256) payable external returns (uint256))

nodes.name: getReturn
convert2
addReserve
approveTokensToCompound
addReserveBalance
uAmount2cAmount
cAmount2uAmount

nodes.documentation:
@dev returns the reserve's balance following the token address, if the token is an underlying token
is hold by compound ctoken contract.
note that prior to version 17, you should use 'getConnectorBalance' instead

      * @param _reserveToken    reserve token contract address

      * @return reserve balance
nodes.name: getReserveBalance

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (uint256) returns (function (contract IERC20Token[] memory,uint256,uint256,address,address,uint256) payable external returns (uint256))

nodes.name: getReturn
convert2

acceptOwnership().details: used by a new owner to accept an ownership transfer

acceptTokenOwnership().details: used by a new owner to accept a token ownership transfer can only be called by the contract owner note that token ownership can only be accepted if its total-supply is greater than zero

addReserve(address,address,uint32).details: all compound tokens going to be listed should be passed through this function with their underlying token.

params._cToken: compound token contract address of the underlying token
params._ratio: constant reserve ratio, represented in ppm, 1-1000000
params._uToken: undelying token used by compound cToken

addReserve(address,uint32).details: defines a new reserve for the token can only be called by the owner while the converter is inactive note that prior to version 17, you should use 'addConnector' instead

params._ratio: constant reserve ratio, represented in ppm, 1-1000000

addReserveBalance(address,uint256).details: This function aims to automate the minting of coumpound tokens when adding its underlying tokens to the reserve It allow also the deposit of any reserve token, user should first approve the ERC20 transer.

approveTokensToCompound().details: This function approves the underlying token used as reserve to be spent by the compound tokens contracts it is most likely to not be called, since apporval of the underlying token is set max_uint for the compound token it is just a safety measure.

cAmount2uAmount(address,address,uint256).details: returns the converted value of a compound token to its underlying token value

params._cToken: compound token contract address of the underlying token
params._uToken: underlying token address used as asset in compound token contract

claimTokens(address,uint256).details: allows the associated BancorX contract to claim tokens from any address (so that users dont have to first give allowance when calling BancorX)

params._amount: the amount of tokens to claim
params._from: address to claim the tokens from

completeXConversion2(address[],uint256,u.details: allows a user to convert BNT that was sent from another blockchain into any other token on the BancorNetwork without specifying the amount of BNT to be converted, but rather by providing the xTransferId which allows us to get the amount from BancorX. note that prior to version 16, you should use 'completeXConversion' instead

params._conversionId: pre-determined unique (if non zero) id which refers to this transaction
params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero
params._path: conversion path, see conversion path format in the BancorNetwork contract

convert2(address,address,uint256,uint256.details: converts a specific amount of _fromToken to _toToken note that prior to version 16, you should use 'convert' instead

params._minReturn: if the conversion results in an amount smaller than the minimum return - it is cancelled, must be nonzero

getFinalAmount(uint256,uint8).details: given a return amount, returns the amount minus the conversion fee

params._magnitude: 1 for standard conversion, 2 for cross reserve conversion

getReserveBalance(address).details: returns the reserve's balance following the token address, if the token is an underlying token is hold by compound ctoken contract. note that prior to version 17, you should use 'getConnectorBalance' instead

getReserveRatio(address).details: returns the reserve's ratio added in version 22

getReturn(address,address,uint256).details: calculates the expected return of converting a given amount of tokens

params._amount: amount of tokens received from the user
params._fromToken: contract address of the token to convert from
params._toToken: contract address of the token to convert to

getReturn(address,address,uint256).return: amount of tokens that the user will receiveamount of tokens that the user will pay as fee

reserveTokenCount().details: returns the number of reserve tokens defined note that prior to version 17, you should use 'connectorTokenCount' instead

restrictRegistryUpdate(bool).details: restricts the permission to update the contract-registry

params._onlyOwnerCanUpdateRegistry: indicates whether or not permission is restricted to owner only

setBancorX(address).details: allows the owner to set the associated BancorX contract

setConversionFee(uint32).details: updates the current conversion fee can only be called by the contract owner

params._conversionFee: new conversion fee, represented in ppm

setConversionWhitelist(address).details: allows the owner to update & enable the conversion whitelist contract address when set, only addresses that are whitelisted are actually allowed to use the converter note that the whitelist check is actually done by the BancorNetwork contract

transferOwnership(address).details: allows transferring the contract ownership the new owner still needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract owner

transferTokenOwnership(address).details: allows transferring the token ownership the new owner needs to accept the transfer can only be called by the contract owner note that token ownership can only be transferred while the owner is the converter upgrader contract

uAmount2cAmount(address,address,uint256).details: returns the converted value of an underlying amount in compound to compound tokens value

params._cToken: compound token contract address of the underlying token
params._uToken: underlying token address used as asset in compound token contract

updateReserveVirtualBalance(address,uint.details: updates a reserve's virtual balance only used during an upgrade process can only be called by the contract owner while the owner is the converter upgrader contract note that prior to version 17, you should use 'updateConnector' instead

params._virtualBalance: new reserve virtual balance, or 0 to disable virtual balance

withdrawFromToken(address,address,uint25.details: withdraws tokens held by the controller and sends them to an account can only be called by the owner

params._to: account to receive the new amount

withdrawTokens(address,address,uint256).details: withdraws tokens held by the converter and sends them to an account can only be called by the owner note that reserve tokens can only be withdrawn by the owner while the converter is inactive unless the owner is the converter upgrader contract

params._to: account to receive the new amount
